page.title: 06LANDRAKE VILLAGE HALL
page.content: This is a large single storey rendered brick and slate tiled hall built in 1930 and named after Sir Robert Geffery (1613-1703) of Tredinnick (near Landrake),an Ironmonger,East India Company merchant and Lord Mayor of London (1686). Main hall has badminton court and well equipped stage.Kitchen & toilets at north end.Behind stage,dressing rooms come surgery and waiting room and toilets added in 1975. Clubroom and storeroom added 1981. Oil central heating modernised in 1984. In 1985 the building was insured for Â£103,500. Attached to the building at north corner is a billiard room,the Solomon Browne Working Men's Club,an organisation quite independent of the Hall.
